data.title: Good Food and service
data.text: Was surprised by this place.  Appetizer combo plate contained delicious chicken tenders (I usually despise these) lobster egg rolls were great and the pretzel balls interesting, good sauces!  Dinner was very good and the 2.00 crème brulee desserts were well worth it.  Try this place if you've never been there!

data.title: Great Burgers!
data.text:
Happened upon Pounds while looking for a place to eat downtown with my tweenage sons. We were disappointed to find out that the age is 21+ at Vinyl Taco (all the time) and Wurst Bier Hall (after 4PM) - and Pounds is right next to Wurst, so we stopped in.

I was pleased with the great menu selections, both food and craft beer. We each ordered a different burger and were absolutely delighted with our choices. Our server was very nice to my sons, who enjoyed the arcade game near the bar.

I love the 38th Parallel burger!

data.title: I don't recommend
data.text: Somehow, they managed to turn a new bar into a college dive.  The tables are sticky.  The bbq we had was ok, but the burgers appear to be processed frozen patties.  Ick.  Overpriced as well.

data.title: Good burgers
data.text: Very good burgers and fries. Whitney was our server and she was nice, knowledgeable about the menu and on top of our needs. We were here in the afternoon and it was not too busy. Cool environment! I would recommend

data.title: Good service, good food.
data.text: I took my husband out for lunch. He said he wanted a burger, so I pulled up the Tripadvisor to see what our options for downtown Fargo were. I found Pounds and comments on burgers. He ordered the Sunset Rider with bacon and I ordered "chicken digits".  He was pleased with his burger. It came with fries and he had commented that they were salty. My chicken digits were also good, but not great. It tasted like the only seasoning they used was salt. It's fried chicken, what can I expect. The Dr. Pepper BBQ sauce was good, but not my favorite. It was a nice atmosphere and the service was good. It was very clean and comfortable.

data.title: Where I go when I'm craving Poutine!
data.text: As a newly relocated Canadian, I find Pounds offers the best Poutine in the FM area. The service was good although they could probably use a few more staff members. You know I'll be back!

data.title: Lunch and beer
data.text: 4+ shoestring fries are the best on town. Beer and burger, major bonus. Must visit and return. Service was great.

data.title: Best Burgers
data.text: Zac served us some burgers.  I had the 38 Burger with kimchi, a new experience. Service was good and friendly.  Beer selection was good.

data.title: Lots of potential
data.text:
This place is hard to rate. Great location, but seems like it is still trying to figure itself out. We went here after walking into the place next door and not feeling up to the noise. This place was much quieter however I think the average age of everyone in here was around 50. Not exactly what I would expect for a place that seems like it is trying to be hip. They had some really fun stuff on the menu I had a burger served between 2 egos with strawberry sauce candied bacon and marshmallow cream. It was very tasty but seems like it could have used some heat to balance it a little. I found the beer to be very reasonable however I got a beer that said on the side taste best in glass. No glass was given. Like I said this place could be great but it seems to be fighting itself for an identity.

Overall I would recommend this place, and I will try it again in the future with the hope that it has the details completed.

data.title: Pot Stop
data.text: My rating is based on burger joint to burger joint comparisons. When driving from Minot, ND to Madison, WI, Fargo seemed like a logical place to stop for food. Nobody wanted fast food, but we also wanted something relatively quick. The hubs and I usually hit up a place down a ways, but we had our 20yr old son with us and they go to 21+ at 4pm. It was 410pm. We decided on Pounds, because the kid eats burgers, and several reviews mentioned lobster rolls, which I haven't had since California. My mouth was already watering. We got the app combo with, what I should point out now, are actually lobster egg rolls , well-made chicken strips from scratch and pretzel bites. Totally different than a lobster roll, still very good. The pretzel bites were good, with ample beer cheese soup for dipping. The burgers choices were greatly varied. All 3 burgers (nooge, orange windmill, and the dr pepper bbq sauce one) were cooked perfectly. There's an option to skip the bun and get a bed of lettuce. They come with fries, which we paid an extra buck to have parmesan cheese and truffle oil added to. The fries were a bit soggy,  presumably from the added oil, but tasty. I had a local sour beer, fabulous. The hubs had the Ugly Sweater, and says he'd drink it again, ha. Service was spot on. We were 1 of 3 tables during service. We would visit again, but we haven't been swayed from frequenting our usual German spot!

data.title: What's The Deal
data.text: Beer very good. Service, excellent. Food? Well, this is a tough one. My impression of the menu is this, what are you trying to do? Pounds is a beer bar with what appears to be an Avant Garde menu. Seriously, how about regular or above regular pub food. I had the Hot Chic sandwich, which was okay. Not good. I also was not sure of what they were aiming for. Sadly, I could never recommend anyone come here for the burgers or entree because its like someone is trying way too hard to be super cool. If people want that than I would switch to a wine or cocktail bar and move away from the beers. This could be an excellent spot if they can get their menu back down to earth. Just one man's opinion.

data.title: We hit them hard and they were sectaculare
data.text:
I can in with a large group and no reservation. I needed a place for "12 kids". Our 12 kids was closer to 14 kids and 8 parents. This resulted in 2 tables in 2 parts of the restaurant with some parents paying for some kids. It could have been a nightmare.
Drinks out in a timely manner, check. Food out, check Food excellent,oh ya! Bills accurate, yep. The guys working were amazing. The food great, and the experiance, will be spoken of far and wide.

data.title: Some of the best service in a long time!
data.text: It was date night for us-and we've been to pounds before, and wanted to go back. We were greeted immediately when walking in, and the great service didn't stop. Our server was personable, fast, and knowledgable. We ordered the CCC app-the lobster rolls were awesome! I also had the eggo burger, and wow!! My husband loved his burger, but I can't remember which one he had. My sweet potato fries were perfectly done, and everything was piping hot when it arrived. We will definitely continue coming back!

data.title: Just OK
data.text: We had lunch here, the food was OK, service was great.  Some of us had burgers, sweet potatoes(which were awesome), Knoephla soup(just OK) and chicken melt(very good).  I guess we've been here!  Overpriced!!!

data.title: Gourmet Burgers
data.text: This place is amazing, was not expecting it to be this good. Everything is outrageously gourmet and fancy for a burger spot. They also have a spectacular beer selection. Order the Roman burger.

data.title: Underwhelmed
data.text:
I don't usually write a review unless I can be somewhat positive, but I have to say, this one is a little hard, especially after the great write-up in our local mag. I read all the previous reviews and they said over and over, lobster rolls, burgers, sweet potato fries. So, that's what I did. 
The lobster rolls WERE very tasty. The outside was done perfectly and not greasy at all, and like I said, the filling was tasty, but more than once I had hot grease squirt out as I bit into it. Not a pretty sight. 
I ordered a burger, and went with the waiters suggestion of the Orange Windmill. I was not a fan. I love all of the ingredients, but this burger, not so much. Others have rivaled them against other local burger places. Not. Even. Close. 
And that's pretty much how dinner went. There was an order of poutine, some knoephla soup, and sweet potato fries another burger and two chicken sandwiches. And not one of us ever raved. About any of it. 
Now let's talk about service. Our friends were waiting for us when we got there and almost immediately after we joined them the waiter came over and interrupted our hellos to ask if he could get a drink order. I don't think the menu was even in my hands yet. So, please come back. Which he did, several times. It bordered on pushy. But once we got our order in he was hard to track down. They repeatedly brought food and drink items to the table without clearing the dishes from the previous round. It was messy and annoying. Fries were served with wrong sandwiches. That kind of stuff. 
The first round of drinks were actually very good. Smokey bloody Mary (ordered it spicy, but not sure it was) and beers everyone enjoyed. After the meal I ordered a caramel apple martini, which was not good. Plus, the waiter spilled some on the table so it was a sticky mess. 
I REALLY wanted to like this place, but downtown has a lot better offerings. Sorry Pounds.

data.title: Great place for a burger lover.
data.text: The decor was nice and minimalist, but the food's flavor was far from minimalist. I had the Roman burger with some sweet potato fries and iced tea, and it was all delicious. The sweet potato fries were especially delicious (borderline amazing), and the server had refilled my drink before I could ask, which was a high mark for their service, to me.

data.title: Next time i will have a burger
data.text: The salads were great and I guess a lesson learned is to order their specialty. The lobster rolls were scrumptious but the appetizer mushrooms were pretty greasy. I will go back and I will have a burger. The descriptions of the burgers sounded really good.

data.title: Downtown Fargo - good place.
data.text: Average atmosphere but always excellent service. Chelsey was great. Ordered a BBQ with French fries with gravy on it.  Very good.

data.title: Awesome experience
data.text: We had poutine and burgers. Our food was great. My hubby had the 38th Parallel and i had the standard burger. They were both very good. I had the Brussel sprouts and the sauce they were in was fantastic. He loved the sweet potato fries. The service was great and it was a nice laid back atmosphere.
